alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:29PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CHARLES...SOUTHERN STAFFORD...NORTHWESTERN KING GEORGE AND SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 529 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Aquia Creek to 6 miles northeast of Bumpass, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Stafford, Fredericksburg, King George, Fairview Beach, Potomac Creek, Nanjemoy Creek, Aquia Creek, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Falmouth, Passapatanzy, Stones Corner, Ironsides, Snell, Partlow, Glenora, Thornburg, White Oak, Sealston and Leeland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
